title: Stopping cSpell from using .gitignore
excerpt: cSpell is a spelling plugin for VS Code. Not my favourite, but the only one I found. It isn't particularly well documented though. It avoids spell checking files in .gitignore. To stop that, you need to add "cSpell.useGitignore": false, to your settings

previous.title: How I built a markdown drive static website with SvelteKit and Tailwind

previous.excerpt: I copy audiobooks from CDs to USB sticks to play them in cars and random device like old radios. But often those devices play the files out of order. Reordering files in <abbr title="File Allocation Table">FAT</abbr> USB sticks is harder than I thought. Luckily, a chap by the name of Boris Leidner has written a useful tool for that.
previous.title: Reordering audio files in a FAT USB stick

previous.title: Stop Chrome navigating back when swiping horizontally
previous.excerpt: If you try to use Google Chrome on a small window on a laptop, perhaps because you are comparing two web pages side by side, swiping left or right doesn't move the page around, but it jumps to the previous or next page. Here's how to prevent that on OS X.

preview.html: If you try to use Google Chrome on a small window on a laptop, perhaps because you are comparing two web pages side by side, swiping left or right doesn't move the page around, but it jumps to the previous or next page. Here's how to prevent that on OS X.

previous.title: How To Avoid sudo npm

previous.excerpt: Extended attributes store extra information about files in OS X. They replaced resource forks. Sometimes those extra hidden files confuse peripherals (e.g. mp3 players) that were not setup to deal with them. Here are some terminal commands to handle them.

previous.excerpt: To make a quick voice recording with OS X: open Quick Time Player, under the File menu there is a "New. Audio Recording" entry. It automatically saves .mov files in your Movies folder, which you can then open in Audacity or the editor of your choice.
previous.title: Making a simple voice recording on a Mac

previous.title: Changing title of CMD window
previous.excerpt:
title some words will change the title of your cmd shell in Window
The title will be `some words` instead of `C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe`. Handy if you have a few of them open and can't tell them apart.

previous.excerpt: I used to do a lot of Google Apps Script (GAS) programming, but Google's never seemed to interested in that product so I gave up. Here I document a simple boilerplate project so that I don't forget how to do it.

previous.title: A good place for scripts in OSX
previous.excerpt:
Where to put unix based scripts on a Mac without them getting in the way? Simple: create a bin folder in your home directory, and add it to the path:
export PATH=~/bin:$PATH

Where to put unix based scripts on a Mac without them getting in the way? Simple: create a bin folder in your home directory, and add it to the path:
